name: Avoid using the standard library time and date functions from "<time.h>" (C/C++)
description:
None of the facilities that are specified as being provided by <time.h> shall be used.
In C99, the identifier wcsftime shall not be used and no macro with this name shall be expanded.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: The time and date functions have unspecified, undefined, and implementation-defined behaviors associated with them.
reference:
Standards reference:
MISRA C 2012 - 21.10: The Standard Library time and date functions shall not be used

AUTOSAR C++, 2014, M18-0-4: The time handling functions of library <ctime> shall not be used

MISRA C++, 2008, 18-0-4: The time handling functions of library <ctime> shall not be used.
alternativeName: Make sure you do not use <time.h> to avoid unexpected and implementation dependent outcome
